#include "control.c"

Data Structures

struct  CTRL
 Definition of a control unit. More...

Defines

#define CONTROL_ACTIVE
 This define can be evaluated to check if this module is included and active.
Configuration Data
The values of these parameters can be overwritten by defining them before including this file.

#define CTRL_LAYER   20
 layer for text display
#define CTRL_TEXTCOL_RED   255
 display text color: red component
#define CTRL_TEXTCOL_GREEN   255
 display text color: green component
#define CTRL_TEXTCOL_BLUE   255
 display text color: blue component
#define CTRL_TEXTCOL_SEL_RED   255
 display selected text color: red component
#define CTRL_TEXTCOL_SEL_GREEN   255
 display selected text color: green component
#define CTRL_TEXTCOL_SEL_BLUE   0
 display selected text color: blue component
#define CTRL_SCALEFACTOR   1.0
 global scale factor for text display
#define CTRL_BASE_RES_X   640
 display reference resolution for x scaling
#define CTRL_BASE_RES_Y   480
 display reference resolution for y scaling
#define CTRL_TEXTOFFS_Y   20
 y offset of text menu (including title)
#define CTRL_FADESPEED   1.5
 text fading speed in seconds (only used when text fading is activated)
Constant Data
These constants are used as parameters for certain functions.

#define CTRL_UNDEFINED   0
#define CTRL_UNLOCKED   0
#define CTRL_LOCKED   1
#define CTRL_MOUSE_START   280
 scancode range for mouse buttons - start
#define CTRL_MOUSE_END   282
 scancode range for mouse buttons - end
#define CTRL_JOY1_START   256
 scancode range for joystick1 buttons - start
#define CTRL_JOY1_END   267
 scancode range for joystick1 buttons - end
#define CTRL_JOY2_START   268
 scancode range for joystick2 buttons - start
#define CTRL_JOY2_END   279
 scancode range for joystick2 buttons - end
#define CTRL_KEY_START   1
 scancode range for keyboard buttons - start
#define CTRL_KEY_END   255
 scancode range for keyboard buttons - end
#define CTRL_ENABLE_FADE   1
 used for CTRL_setFlags: enables fading for menu visibility toggling
#define CTRL_DENY_MOUSE   2
 used for CTRL_setFlags: do not allow mouse buttons for key assignment
#define CTRL_DENY_JOY1   4
 used for CTRL_setFlags: do not allow joystick1 buttons for key assignment
#define CTRL_DENY_JOY2   8
 used for CTRL_setFlags: do not allow joystick2 buttons for key assignment
#define CTRL_DENY_KEY   16
 used for CTRL_setFlags: do not allow keyboard keys for key assignment

Detailed Description

Function Documentation

CTRL* CTRL_create ( var  vNumKeys,
STRING *  strTitle 
)

Creates new Control Manager.

Use CTRL_setDescription and CTRL_setFunction to configure state manager. Configuration must be applied during project initialization before usage of control manager. Uses default font and default behaviour flags.

Parameters:
vNumKeys number of reconfigurable keys
strTitle title of key control setup menu
Returns:
Pointer to CTRL structure

CTRL* CTRL_create ( var  vNumKeys,
STRING *  strTitle,
STRING *  strFont,
var  vTextFlags 
)

Creates new key control manager.

Use CTRL_setDescription and CTRL_setFunction to configure state manager. Configuration must be applied during project initialization before usage of control manager.

Parameters:
vNumKeys number of reconfigurable keys
strTitle title of key control setup menu
strFont filename of bitmap font or name of Truetype font
vTextFlags any bit combination of key control menu flags (CTRL_ENABLE_..., CTRL_DENY_...)
Returns:
Pointer to CTRL structure

void CTRL_hide ( CTRL *  psCtrl  ) 

Hide key control layout.

Hide the key control layout of the given pointer. Use CTRL_setFlags() to setup additional display features like fading.

Parameters:
psCtrl pointer to CTRL structure

void CTRL_isActive ( CTRL *  psCtrl  ) 

Check visibility key control layout.

Parameters:
psCtrl pointer to CTRL structure

var CTRL_load ( CTRL *  psCtrl,
STRING *  strFile 
)

Loads key coniguration from disk.

Load key configuration with given filename.

Parameters:
psCtrl pointer to CTRL structure
strFile Filename of config file
Returns:
1: successsful - 0: failure

void CTRL_remove ( CTRL *  psCtrl  ) 

Remove key control manager.

Returns:
Pointer to CTRL structure

var CTRL_save ( CTRL *  psCtrl,
STRING *  strFile 
)

Saves current key coniguration.

Store key configuration with given filename.

Parameters:
psCtrl pointer to CTRL structure
strFile Filename of config file
Returns:
1: successsful - 0: failure

void CTRL_setFlags ( CTRL *  psCtrl,
var  vFlags 
)

Set text flags.

Set any flag CTRL_ENABLE_..., CTRL_DENY_... to influence behaviour of the control setup.

Parameters:
psCtrl pointer to CTRL structure
vFlags any valid TEXT flag

void CTRL_show ( CTRL *  psCtrl  ) 

Show key control layout.

Shows the key control layout of the given pointer. Use CTRL_setFlags() to setup additional display features like fading.

Parameters:
psCtrl pointer to CTRL structure
